intro: Aphloia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are typically harvested when fully mature. The leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and greenish-white in color. It is often found in dry, rocky areas and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat.
